subject: Economics
title: Open Source Economics: Free Labor That Creates Billions
description: A short lesson to help you apply Open Source Economics: Free Labor That Creates Billions.

hook.text: Linux powers 96% of the world's servers. It was built by volunteers working for free.

buildup.text: Open source: software whose code is freely shared, modified, and distributed. It defies economics.

discovery.text: Developers contribute for reputation, skill-building, and career advancement.

twist.text: Big Tech profits enormously from open source but contributes unevenly.

climax.text: Open source proves that collaboration can outperform competition.

punchline.text: The most valuable software in the world was built for free ‚Äî and nobody owns it.
